frame.name: Unemployment_rate
frame.definition:
<def-root>Based on how many <fen>Individuals</fen> are employed, the <fen>Individuals</fen> as a whole are described with a <fen>Value</fen> (either a percentage or absolute number) representing the <fen>Employment</fen> of the <fen>Individuals</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Employment"><t>Unemployment</t></fex> is down, salaries are up for US chemists.</ex>
<ex>As a result, the <fex name="Employment"><t>unemployment</t></fex> <fex name="Individuals">of Roma</fex> is very high.</ex>
<ex>Today's report finds that <fex name="Employment"><t>unemployment</t></fex> <fex name="Group">among single mothers</fex> rose for the first time in six years in 2002. <fex name="Individuals">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex>In the 1950s and '60s, <fex name="Employment"><t>joblessness</t></fex> <fex name="Value">of 6 to 7 percent</fex> was intense, but now an unemployment rate of below 6 percent could be inflationary. <fex name="Individuals">DNI</fex>. </ex>
<ex>The economy was operating at full capacity, traditionally defined as <fex name="Employment"><t>employment</t></fex> <fex name="Value">of 96 percent of the civilian labor force</fex>. <fex name="Individuals">DNI</fex></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Individuals
FE.definition:
<def-root>The group of people whose employment status is considered.
<ex>The high <t>unemployment</t> <fex name="Individuals">of the Romany population</fex> is one of the key issues, which need addressing.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Employment
FE.definition:
<def-root>The property of a group of <fen>Individuals</fen> describing how many of them are employed or unemployed.
<ex>The statistics are shocking: <fex name="emp"><t>unemployment</t></fex> is 57 per cent.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition:
<def-root>The count or percentage of people among the group of <fen>Individuals</fen> that are of the specified employment status.
<ex>While current <t>unemployment</t> <fex name="Value">of about 6%</fex> isn't high by historical standards, there's no denying this trend toward job exportation.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Value</fen> from the norm.
<ex>This leads to <fex name="deg">high</fex> <t>joblessness</t> in some pockets.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> during which <fen>Employment</fen> level of the <fen>Individuals</fen> has a specified <fen>Value</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Time">Last month's</fex> <t>unemployment</t> was 5.17 percent on a seasonally-adjusted basis.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number or rate of individuals that are either employed or unemployment may be contrasted, implicitly or explicitly, with different groups.
<ex>Ministers believe youth <t>unemployment</t> <fex name="gro">among Canada's Aboriginal population</fex> requires special and immediate attention.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Individuals</fen> under consideration reside.
<ex>A stadium is expected to cost $350 million, and financial woes caused by recession and high <t>joblessness</t> <fex name="pla">in Oregon</fex> all but rule out public financing.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: unemployment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the number or proportion of unemployed people.

lexUnit.name: joblessness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the number or proportion of jobless people.

lexUnit.name: employment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: as opposed to unemployment, the number or proportion of employed people.
